column4: I'm trying to get my phone to show up so I can transfer files off it, it's a motorola zn300, it looks like it's being detected but not getting mounted http://paste.ubuntu.com/572241/
many phones have a data mode, or usb-storage mode setting you need to use when you plug them into a pc.
my phone is saying usb mass storage on the screen when I plug it in
try mounting it by hand. check output of sudo fdisk -l, dmesg, and blkid to see what device its being
http://paste.ubuntu.com/572241/ there is my output from dmesg and lsusb, how do I mount it though?
sudo mount /dev/whatever /media/MAKEADIRCTORY
where are you getting the whatever?
from the commands i mentioned earlier...
when you plug it in, wait a few moments and run 'dmesg' it should mention the device.. or  fdisk -l shows ALL devices
http://paste.ubuntu.com/572241/ this is my dmesg and lsusb output
look for /dev/XXXXX type lines mentioned when you plug the thing in.
it doesn't say anything like that http://paste.ubuntu.com/572241/
check 'sudo fdisk -l' perhaps the phone is just not seen.
it does see it, fdisk -l doesn't do anything, I see it in dmesg and lsusb though
its 'sudo fdisk -l'
that just shows my harddrive and swap files
below those lines it should eventually mention  a /dev/sdXX
sounds like its not detecting it as a usb storage device.
I just have an sda1 sda2 and sda5
sounds like its not detecting it as a usb storage device device.
yeah, it does anything I can do about that
check google for your exact phone and linux. is this a 'smart' phone runnign android?
no it's a motorola zn300, already check google not much out there, the phone is runnign a linux OS, but not andriod or anything it's not a smart phone just a regular phone
